metadata.title: CVE-2021-42771 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Babel.Locale in Babel before 2.9.1 allows attackers to load arbitrary locale .dat files (containing serialized Python objects) via directory traversal, leading to code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-42771` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-babel-localedata - 2.8.0+dfsg.1-7
python3-babel - 2.8.0+dfsg.1-7
No subscription required

notes.note: leosilva> fixed as CVE-2021-20095. But that CVE number was rejected and that new one was assigned to that issue.

criterions.comment: python-babel package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.0+dfsg.1-7').
